props.title: Great Understanding!
props.message: You correctly identified the for loop behavior.
props.explanation: For loops initialize i to 0, run while i < 5, and increment i after each iteration. This produces output: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4. The loop condition i < 5 means it stops before reaching 5.

props.title: Excellent Reasoning!
props.message: You've identified the structural difference between loop types.
props.explanation: For loops are used when you know the number of iterations; they combine initialization, condition, and increment. While loops are used for conditional iteration where the number of repetitions isn't predetermined. Both serve different purposes in your code.
